alert.note: Alert for Crook County Plains; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 22 at 2:17AM MDT until October 22 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FAR SOUTHWEST SOUTH DAKOTA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY ACROSS MUCH OF NORTHEAST WYOMING...THE BLACK HILLS...AND THE REST OF SOUTHERN SOUTH DAKOTA... .Today will be warm and dry across much of the area as a warm front lifts slowly north across northeast Wyoming, the Black Hills, and southern South Dakota. Southwesterly winds will become quite gusty near and to the south of the boundary in the afternoon, with humidity values dropping into the teens. Combined with dry fuels, this will produce critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 316, 318, 319, 323, AND 329... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 7 PM MDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 316 Crook County Plains, 318 Wyoming Black Hills, 319 Northern Black Hills, 323 Northern Foot Hills and 329 West Central Plains. * WINDS...South to southwest 15 to 25 mph. Gusts up to 45 mph across the higher elevations of the Black Hills. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Crook County Plains; Wyoming Black Hills
